p: This genotype circulates in the western sub-Saharan regions of Africa and hasnâ€™t been identified outside of this region. It has been documented in periodic outbreaks in Senegal and Nigeria and is typically associated with dengue-like illness accompanied by arthralgia [ 26, 27, 45, 90, 115, 116, 117, 118]. In children, the disease is a minor and self-limiting febrile illness with no debilitating or neurological sequelae reported, even in recent outbreaks ( Table 1) [ 45].
